Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Functional tests fail due to SQL timeouts" (#8368) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The PROD Gallery functional tests have failed repeatedly:

* https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=77508&view=results
* https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=77522&view=results
* https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=77526&view=results

This is caused by SQL timeouts during this query:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Download stats are showing unlisted packages" (#8404) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: nuget.org

Product version:  Website

## Repro steps and/or sample project

Create an unlisted version.
Generate some downloads for it.
Visit the downloads page, and note that unlisted packages are... listed:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1378165/105942706-9f1ca880-6014-11eb-8015-c17897346878.png)

Unlisted packages should only show here if you're signed in as a package owner.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add fuget.org link to package details page" (#7850) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is the issue tracking the community PR: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7832 as it needs some UX and messaging work before going live.

Rationale for the feature: 
fuget.org shows API level data for the packages and lets you compare the APIs across versions. This has been super useful for developers and they have already been using this. It would make sense for developers to directly explore their package on fuget.org from nuget.org's package details page.

### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### Describe the bug
The error described above and other identical errors for different packages has suddenly started appearing today during our build process using Docker on Linux. Other people seem to have encountered the same problem in the last few hours. Dotnet restore works fine on Windows.

### To Reproduce

### Expected behavior
No error during:

dotnet restore

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PM UI:  some remote errors not propagated" (#10497) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

If a remote service throws some exception types, the exception is not propagated to the client.  For example, if a `NullReferenceException` is thrown, then [`RemoteErrorUtility.ToRemoteError(...)`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/7297f2661ed2b39f3d9a9ced49f562974a7da2f4/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Internal.Contracts/Utility/RemoteErrorUtility.cs#L20-L65) will set `RemoteError.ProjectContextLogMessage` to `null`.  That `null` will result in an `ArgumentException` from a `string.Format(...)` call in the client.

Note that this bug surfaced because a [previous "refactoring"](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3532) made a behavioral change, which is forbidden in a refactoring.  Specfically, [this change](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3532/files#diff-bca31398f36405165287da966744516c7de236735610fae45f9991381b2637b6R47) redirected a logging call from [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3532/files#diff-bca31398f36405165287da966744516c7de236735610fae45f9991381b2637b6R47) to [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3532/files#diff-6b87d06c0b1ec26d23cc9fd4f5a3a6983895079e42e6dae6d1b3cc8f8b52e02cR108-R126).  The latter call writes a message to the Output window and, if the message is a warning or error, also adds the message to the Error List.  This is incorrect behavior.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe):  VS

Product version: Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Int Preview
Version 16.9.0 Preview 4.0 [30928.13.main]

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:  The release before https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3711

## Repro steps and/or sample project

I don't have a simple repro.  I found this issue while writing a unit test and then verified it by forcing a particular exception be thrown while under a debugger.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Some packages restore successfully on sdk:5.0 Docker image but fail verify command" (#10500) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: `dotnet`
Product version: .NET SDK 5.0

Image ID for `mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:5.0`: `e735190c5cb9`

`dotnet --info` from the Docker image:
```
.NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   5.0.102
 Commit:    71365b4d42

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     debian
 OS Version:  10
 OS Platform: Linux
 RID:         debian.10-x64
 Base Path:   /usr/share/dotnet/sdk/5.0.102/
```

## Repro steps and/or sample project

Use this `Dockerfile`:

```
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:5.0
WORKDIR /src
RUN dotnet new classlib
 
RUN dotnet nuget locals --clear all
RUN rm -rf obj
RUN rm -rf bin
RUN dotnet add package PostSharp.Patterns.Common --version 6.3.6-preview
RUN ls -la ~/.nuget/packages/
RUN dotnet nuget verify ~/.nuget/packages/postsharp.patterns.common.redist/6.3.6-preview/postsharp.patterns.common.redist.6.3.6-preview.nupkg -v diag
```

Run this command:
```
docker build --no-cache -t nutest .
```

Thank you @loic-sharma for questing with me and sharing his mad Docker skills.

### Expected

I expect either the restore to fail with trust issues like https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10491 (since the author certificate is expired, the timestamper is Symantec) or **both** the restore succeeds and `dotnet nuget verify` succeeds or they both fail.


### Actual

Restore succeeds. Packages are extracted to the user package folder. Scary!

Verify fails with:
```
error: NU3028: The repository countersignature's timestamp found a chain building issue: UntrustedRoot: self signed certificate in certificate chain
```

### Tried packages

All of the packages tried so far:
- 😱 `PostSharp.Patterns.Common 6.3.6-preview` - this report
- 😱 `BiExcellence.OpenBi.Api.Entity 0.0.11-ci-5530` - same as this report AFAIK
- 😕 `Yoctopuce.YoctoLib 1.10.36218` - same issue as https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10491, but a 3rd party package

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Debian-based OSes" (#49) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hey Everyone,

Our preliminary investigation shows that .NET 5 restore is broken for Debian-based operating systems including Docker thus resulting in error messages like:

```
error NU3037: Package 'System.Memory 4.5.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
```

### [Debian Versions](https://www.debian.org/releases/)
- We're currently aware that Debian 10 ("buster") and earlier versions are affected. ❌
- We do know that Debian testing ("bullseye") and later are not affected. ✔

This is because of an [issue reported](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=962596) in the `ca-certificates` package in which the root CA being used are not trusted and must be installed manually due to [Symantec Issues](https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA:Symantec_Issues). Because this issue has been resolved recently in version 20210119 of this package, it is not available in a Debian version as provided in `dotnet-docker` for `buster-slim` today.

## Workarounds

- Manually update the [ca-certificates](https://packages.debian.org/bullseye/ca-certificates) package to version 20210119 including a `bullseye` or later version.
- Consider using a different Debian-based Docker image such as `alpine` or `focal`.
 
## Solution

We're currently working to update the `dotnet-docker`'s `buster-slim` image to update the `ca-certificates` package to 20210119 that resolves this issue. We are however currently verifying this is a viable solution with no large diffs between the `buster` and `bullseye` releases.

Additionally, the `ca-certificates` package is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive which will promote this fix to the `buster` release in the next few days to which an updated `buster-slim` image will be prepared and released when available.

## Stay Updated

- We are continuing to investigate this issue and will let you know more as we find out.
- We'll continue to update the discussion at https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10491.
- We will also continue posting updates on https://status.nuget.org and on Twitter @NuGet.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	· **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**  – 48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
 
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	· UTC-9 to UTC-2 – [Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	· UTC-1 to UTC+6 – [Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	· UTC+7 to UTC-10 – [Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
